gml:Point.gml:name: Tie Point in upper left corner

abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Vegetation Condition Indicator (VCI) is a categorical type of difference vegetation index. The VCI compares the observed NDVI to the range of values observed in the same period in previous years. The VCI is expressed in % and gives an idea where the observed value is situated between the extreme values (minimum and maximum) in the previous years. Lower and higher values indicate bad and good vegetation state conditions, respectively.

purpose.gco:CharacterString: This product is first designed to fit the requirements of the Global Land component of Land Service of GMES-Copernicus. It can be also useful for all applications related to the environment monitoring.

credit.gco:CharacterString: “Vegetation Condition Index products were generated by the land service of Copernicus, the Earth Observation programme of the European Commission. The research leading to the current version of the product has received funding from various European Commission Research and Technical Development programs. The algorithm was originally developed in the framework of the MARSOP program by VITO and JRC. The product is based on PROBA-V 1km data ((c) ESA and distribution by VITO).”

fees.gco:CharacterString: Free by ftp and Eumetcast; cost of medium by DvD or tape

orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Products can be downloaded on-line via HTTP (or FTP) or can be received through EUMETCast satellite reception in Africa and Latin-America. Users can also get the latest datasets in near-real time via FTP after subscription. Through http://land.copernicus.eu/global/access, users can subscribe to receive future products as well as placing orders to retrieve the product archive (massive order). You will be informed through e-mail whenever new products are ready on the FTP server to be downloaded.

description.gco:CharacterString: 1. Search and Order products on Dataset Catalogue and Ordering service
2. Subscribe to receive future products via e-mail
3. Register to receive products via Eumetcast

title.gco:CharacterString: Validation results conform CEOS LPV guidelines
INSPIRE Data Specification on orthoimagery - Guidelines

statement.gco:CharacterString: The input data are the 10-days synthesis of multispectral surface reflectances of PROBA-VEGETATION data and more particular the derived NDVI value together with a historical mean of the NDVI calculated over the period from 1999 till last available full year. The VCI or “Vegetation Condition Index” was first proposed by Kogan (1990, 1994, 1995) and is computed as: VCI [%]=100.(NDVI–NDVImin)/(NDVImax–NDVImin), with NDVImin and NDVImax the extreme values observed in the previous years (always per pixel and period). The VCI logically varies between 0% and 100%. The lower and higher values respectively indicate bad and good vegetation state conditions, while normal situations have VCI fluctuating around 50%. The VCI is easy to compute and has been used widely in literature, for instance by FAO’s Agricultural Stress Index System (Rojas et al., 2012). However, VCI-values can sometimes be misleading, because the entire concept is based on the observed extremes, which often might be biased, especially if the used NDVI-series has not been smoothed before.
